prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and the translation vector to (0.0, 0.2876, 0.0). Next, create the 2D sketch for this part. The sketch consists of a single face (face_1). Face_1 contains a single loop (loop_1). Loop_1 has four line segments: 1. line_1: Start point (0.0, 0.0156), end point (0.5027, 0.0) 2. line_2: Start point (0.5027, 0.0), end point (0.5144, 0.3778) 3. line_3: Start point (0.5144, 0.3778), end point (0.0112, 0.3749) 4. line_4: Start point (0.0112, 0.3749), end point (0.0, 0.0156) After creating the 2D sketch, scale it using the sketch scale parameter of 0.5144. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following euler angles and translation vector: euler angles (0.0, 0.0, -90.0), translation vector (0.0, 0.2876, 0.0). Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.2876 and the extrude depth opposite the normal to 0.0. Part 2: Cut-Out Rectangular Prism Construct a cut-out rectangular prism on the top side of the previously created three-dimensional rectangular prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and the translation vector to (0.2794, 0.0, 0.0). Next, create the 2D sketch for this part. The sketch consists of a single face (face_1). Face_1 contains a single loop (loop_1). Loop_1 has three line segments: 1. line_1: Start point (0.0, 0.3765), end point (0.2232, 0.0) 2. line_2: Start point (0.2232, 0.0), end point (0.235, 0.3778) 3. line_3: Start point (0.235, 0.3778), end point (0.0, 0.3765) After creating the 2D sketch, scale it using the sketch scale parameter of 0.3778. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Since this is a cut-out feature, set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.0 and the extrude depth opposite the normal to 0.2876.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1 Instructions** **1.0 Describe the Shape** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom, with dimensions provided in the description. **1.1 Create the Coordinate System** Begin by creating a new coordinate system, adhering to the following specifications: - Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0], which corresponds to rotating the 2D sketch plane along the X, Y, and Z axes, respectively. - Set the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.5, 0.0], which represents the positions and distances to displace the origin of the sketch plane. **1.2 Draw the Sketch for Part 1** For this part, the sketch will be drawn on a plane defined by the coordinate system. Perform the following steps to create the sketch: **1.2.1 Create Face 1** - Create the first face in the sketch, on which subsequent loops and curves will be defined. The face will be rectangular and will serve as the base for the prism. **1.2.2 Create Loop 1 on Face 1** - Construct Loop 1 using the following sequence of curves, starting from the bottom-left corner of the rectangle and moving counterclockwise. - Complete Loop 1 with the following curves: * Curve 1 (line): Beginning at [0.0, 0.0], go to [0.75, 0.0]. * Curve 2 (line): From [0.75, 0.0], proceed to [0.75, 0.25]. * Curve 3 (line): Move from [0.75, 0.25], to [0.25, 0.25]. * Curve 4 (line): Go from [0.25, 0.25], to [0.25, 0.625]. * Curve 5 (line): Proceed from [0.25, 0.625], to [0.0, 0.625]. * Curve 6 (line): Move from [0.0, 0.625], back to [0.0, 0.0]. All loops must be closed. **1.3 Apply Scaling and Extrusion** Once the sketch is completed, perform the following steps to scale the sketch and extrude it into a 3D model: **1.3.1 Scale the Sketch** Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 to the sketch prior to transforming it into a 3D sketch. **1.3.2 Transform Sketch into 3D Sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. **1.3.3 Extrude the Sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector by 0.5 units to generate the 3D model of the prism, resulting in the final shape of Part 1. **1.4 Provide Dimensions for Part 1** The dimensions for the final shape of Part 1 are provided in the descriptive data: - The length of Part 1 is 0.75 units. - The width of Part 1 is 0.5 units. - The height of Part 1 is 0.75 units. For Part 2 and beyond, provide similar step-by-step instructions based on the CAD Assembly JSON, as described in sections 1.0 to 1.4 for Part 1. Always adhere to the same format and stylistic</description>
